text: A DOZEN gorgeous, leggy GIRLS fight for the mirror. Miles skin. Heavy make-up. Lashes. Boobs. Butts. Fishnets. Boas. And SEQUINS. Oceans of them. It's definitely decadent. Completely cabaret.

Come to think of it, none of them are all that good, which isn't all that bad... SEAN (31), a cute gay guy with an armful of accessories pushes his way through the girls and in a blur, tightens corset, tosses a boa, adjusts a garter just so.
Eight shows a week. Sixteen gorgeous girls. Thirty-two towers of luscious legs...
Behind her, our GIRLS slink onto the stage one by one.

Say hello to Scarlett. Jesse. Anna. Coco-puff. And Georgie-Girl. The girls gather at the edge of the stage, lit by footlig moving in place to the beat of the INTRO MUSIC. Hips sway Fingers snap. Tess weaves playfully between them.
All of them the creme-de la creme.
De la creme. The girls strike nasty, (but funny) provocative poses, et
Each one a bastion of bodacious... (Coco bends over, peers between her legs) Elegance. TWO GIRLS upside down on chairs NAIL aerial splits. 3.
Not to mention their other... (smacks Coco on the ass) Ass-ets. Coco raises a brow, moves her butt to a LOUD BUMP-AND-GRI

Welcome to the Burlesque Lounge, dead smack in the center of the Sunset Strip-- did I say "strip?" (cat calls from audience) I meant TEASE... FOOTLIGHTS FLARE, UPLIGHTING THE GIRLS. They shift their weight, hitting the beats with risque moves and hip-thrus as they MOVE DOWNSTAGE suggestively toward the audience t the MUSIC...

A small, grime-streaked steel town, hanging on by the ski its teeth. Boarded-up storefronts, a run-down A&P. CAMERA MOVES past an old sign: WELCOME TO GRUNDY!!! and lands on a broken neon sign that reads "DWIG 'S BAR" It flickers s you can read the name: DWIGHT'S. Then goes back to DWIG.

Chipped paint. Old beer posters. A few pathetic customers Beer on tap. Pinball standing lonely in the corner. A REGULAR drains his beer, tosses down a quarter and star to leave. Someone stops short at the table.

Uh, excuse me? You forgot something. He turns. Sees: ALI ROSE. One hand holding a bar rag, the other planted o her hip. Ali has a look that's all her own: short shorts, white platform sandals, hair piled up high, more make-up the rest of Grundy's women combined. She's young -- 22 -- but has a confidence that's got nothing to do with age.
No, that's your tip. 4.

Huh. See, now that's interesting -- you and I must do math completely differently, cause me? I start with the six beers I brought you, add the four spills I cleaned up, the five times I refilled your peanuts, plus the three times you "accidentally" touched my ass, then I tack on lying to your wife when she called looking for you, twice, and I come up with a sum that's a hell of a lot more than twenty-five cents. Before the Regular can respond, Ali is joined by LORETTA 30's wearing every one of those years hard.
She's just teasing, Ike. You go on home now, and tell Kay I said hi. The Regular leaves. Loretta picks up the quarter.
It's better than nothing.
Nothin's cheap. A quarter's an insult.
It'll cover half a load down at the Spanky Clean.
There's only one thing a quarter is good for. Ali takes the quarter and heads to the back of the room, passing a GEEZER who's sitting by himself, drinking alone
Oh no, hon, now you know how Dwight feels about that.
Dwight isn't here. Ali stops in front of the rinky-dink karaoke machine.
He could come back any minute. 5.

Tough. I'm not working here for the tips Loretta. She pops the quarter into the machine and chooses a song. She picks up the microphone and, after a few opening beat starts singing ETTA JAMES'S "SOMETHING'S GOT A HOLD ON ME

head_text.subj: OOOOOOOOOH, SOMETIMES I GET A GOOD

text: And now we see where the confidence comes from. She's got voice that's way too big for this town-- the kind that reaches way down inside you and rattles things loose. WE HEAR the same song continue as we INTERCUT with:
The Girls undulate at the footlights as they sing the cho
IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali is belting now. Loretta is torn betw enjoying listening and watching the door for Dwight.

head_text.subj: I GET A FEELING THAT I NEVER,
NEVER, NEVER HAD BEFORE, NO, NO ...

text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE the Girls belt out a raucous choru
As other ENTERTAINERS appear onstage:

The insatiable La Puccini Triplets! Death-defying daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille! The Countess of contortion, Eva Destruction! And how about a little love for those bad boys of burlesque, our naughty- bawdy bumber band! THE TATTOOED BAND blares as the troupe kicks in unison 6. IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali sings, with a powerful vocal quality reminiscent of Etta James, Sarah Vaughn, Billy Holiday.

head_text.subj: I JUST WANT TO TELL YOU RIGHT NOW,

text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE, the GIRLS and the BAND, loud and bawdy.
IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali, letting loose now. Wailing.

SOMETHING'S GOT A HOLD ON ME,

IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali, letting it rip. The Geezer sips his beer, unmoved.

text: IN THE BURLESQUE LOUNGE, The Girls, Tess, the other Entertainers, Busboys, Waitresses, Bartenders and entire company do a BIG FINISH.
IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali finishes the song. Loretta CLAPS. Th Geezer, unimpressed, gets up and leaves.
People around here wouldn't know talent if it bit 'em in the Danglies. Where you gotta go is Des Moines. They got karaoke bars where you can win a hundred bucks a night.

Loretta-- when I get out of this butt-hole of a town, I sure as shit won't be heading for Des Moines. She hops up onto the bar, spins around on her butt, one l up in the air like a Varga girl, then hops down on the ot side then gets back to work.
The audience is still applauding as the Performers crowd the backstage area, squeezing past the Puccini Triplets preparing their act. Tess comes off stage and bumrushes Sean.
Where the hell is Nikki?
Rehab, if there's a God. The BACKSTAGE DOOR BURSTS OPEN revealing-- 8.
I heard that. Nikki, a stunning, feisty brunette, sashays in--
Jesus, Nikki, you're later than Georgia's period! Where were you?
Weave, wax, paws and claws. She drops her bag, quickly peels her clothes off, holds o her arms as Sean slips her corset onto her-- Tess eyes Nikki's body--
Hold it right there. Weigh in. Nikki unwillingly steps on the scale. Tess shakes her hea
Put on five pounds or I bump you. Nikki protests as Sean double-takes at Georgia -- who FLI BY with a slightly protruding belly.
Ali winds her way through the trailers, carrying a bag of take-out, with a swing in her step -- moving to music pla in her head. She reaches a double-wide, lets herself in.
Nanna? Got your pot roast here!
TV noise. She comes in, kicks off her heels.

They were out of steak fries, so I got you some of those... Then she stops in her tracks. Nanna -- 80's, housecoat, oxygen tank -- is slumped in her chair. The TV remote is the floor. "ENTERTAINMENT TONIGHT" is blaring.
Nanna? 9.
Loretta and Ali, at the grave with a MINISTER who looks t about 17. A CEMETERY WORKER is nearby, picking his teeth with a toothpick.
Dear Lord, we gather here today not to mourn, but to celebrate the life of Alison Rose.
Arlene.
What?
She's Arlene. I'm Alison.
Oh, shit. (then, befuddled) Can I start over? Ali rolls her eyes.
The Minister and the Cemetery worker walk away, leaving A and Loretta alone.
You were real good to her, Ali.
No, she was good to me. She rearranges the flowers resting on the plot, fixing it
And she wasn't even my real Nanna.
What...?
Foster care. She took me in for the checks. When I turned eighteen, the money stopped coming. She could've kicked me out, but she didn't.
She had a lot of pain at the end. Nothing she talked about, but I could tell.
Well, then I guess this is a blessing. Now she's free. ON ALI, thinking realizing:
(talking about herself) Yeah. I guess she is.
Nanna's clothes - mostly flowered housedresses -- are fol in paper bags. Her belongings are stacked up in the corne CLOSE ON ALI'S MATTRESS, as she pulls a WAD OF CASH out f under it.
Nikki leads a GROUP OF GIRLS in a raucous routine to "HON ROCK". Very Moulin Rouge.
In the wings, Tess watches with Sean.
Girls look good tonight.
Amazing what a pink spotlight can do. Hides more cellulite than a burka.
MOVE IN ON ALI, as she counts the money. Shit. Not enough Then she looks around the trailer and realizes - tough sh Stuffs the money in a pocket, then pulls out a suitcase. 11.
The Burlesque Girls tease the crowd.

THE SUITCASE, as Ali throws in her belongings. When it's full, she grabs a stack of records -- Jazz and Soul -- tr to fit them into the suitcase, but it won't close. She pi one: ETTA JAMES. She sticks it in the suitcase and zips i up.

Ali reaches into a drawer, pulls out a FRAMED PHOTO of A YOUNG WOMAN, 20's, short dress, heavy make-up, holding ha with a 7-year-old girl. Ali slips it into the suitcase pocket. She takes one last look around the trailer.
CLOSE ON ALI'S WHITE PLATFORMS, strutting down the street
Ali enters. DWIGHT is at the bar: 50's, beer gut, humorle
You're three days late.
I had a death in the family. 12.
And what, people stop drinking cause your grandma died? Get your apron and get to work.
I'm not here to work. I'm leaving.
You are?
Yeah.
I just came for my back pay.
Payday's the end of the month.
But, I won't be here then. And you owe me for three weeks.
I don't owe anyone anything till the end of the month. Ali sets down her suitcase and marches over to him.
You know what, Dwight? Contrary to what you've been told, there's no law in Grundy that says you have to spend every waking minute being a tight-fisted, cheap-ass prick --
(trying to intercede) Ooh, hon, I'm not sure that particular approach is gonna --
I've spent three years of my life

--And you'll probably spend another three. You want to quit? Good riddance. I'll replace you before you hit the county line, but I sure ain't gonna pay for the privilege. He walks out the back door, slamming it behind him. 13. ANGLE ON: THE CASH REGISTER. Ali opens the drawer, pulls a wad of cash. Peering out back to make sure Dwight isn't coming in, Ali counts out some money.
What are you doing?
I'm only taking what he owes me.
How much was that bike you been wanting for little Keith? Ali STUFFS a few TWENTIES into Loretta's apron-- pockets rest.
Ali-- where are you gonna go?
Somewhere I can breathe. Now gimme a hug, I gotta get out of here before he gets back. Loretta hugs her tight, then looks Ali in the eye, concer
You can't just head off into the sunset without a plan.
Watch me. Ali gives her one more hug, then grabs her bag and leaves
Ali takes off down the street. She passes TWO OLDER WOMEN waiting for a bus. A beat as they watch her pass. Then:
She'll be back. As Ali heads off, we HEAR:
Ali is at the ticket counter.
How much to Los Angeles?
One way or round-trip?
You're kidding, right?

Cabaret chairs as they DROP FROM THE CEILING. The girls CATCH them, SPIN them around, SLAM them down and LAND ON IN VARIOUS LAYOUTS. IN THE WINGS, Tess hands Sean her corset as she slips int slinky dress. He takes her cigarette holder and grips it between his teeth as he zips her in.
They're loving you tonight.
They're loving you.
Oh, shucks, I just tell myself I'm writing for a big old drag queen.
Eat me. As he heads off with her discarded costume:
A big old foul-mouthed drag queen! Tess looks in a mirror. As she makes the necessary adjustments, VINCE SCALI appears. 35, scruffy-handsome.
Good show tonight. She glances up, sees him. Gets icy. Goes back to primping
Too bad the club's half-empty. 15.
Half-full.
I got another call from Marcus Gerber.
And you told him we weren't selling.
He wants to raise his offer. I told him we'd hear him out. Tess spins around, looking him in the eye for the first t
Vince, I don't care what the number is; the only way Marcus Gerber will get this club from me is by prying it out of my cold, dead, heavily- jeweled fingers. She pivots away and sweeps into the club.
Big finish, the number on stage ends.

Ali's on the bus, in a seat by herself. A LITTLE GIRL in front of her is peering over the chair, watching Ali. Ali smiles at her. The Little Girl's mother notices, gets the girl to sit down by tickling her. Ali unzips the pocket on her suitcase, takes out the FRAM PHOTO of the mom and girl, looks at it. Then she looks ou the window and watches America fly by as DAY TURNS TO NIG
Over which we HEAR someone channel surfing radio static--
Ali sits with her radio headset, searching stations as... 16.
102.7 KIIS FM. Broadcasting from Hollywood and Vine... Ali perks up-- looks out the window as the bus rounds a b and... THE HOLLYWOOD SIGN comes into view. NEW MUSIC UP:

The rush of tourists and traffic. Through a sea of people moving down the crowded sidewalk we FIND ALI as she emerg through the crowd, carrying her bags. Looking around at t exciting city. She SPOTS a SHITTY HOTEL with a sign: "$49 a night." She looks up at it. Then heads across the stree

Cramped, dingy carpet, chipped paint. Key in the door. Th MIDDLE-EASTERN HOTEL MANAGER -- 40's -- leads Ali in, pointing out the features of the room, speaking fast in a impossibly thick Kurdish accent. Ali nods along, not understanding a word. When he stops:
Okay!
Well. Good luck with that. He drops her suitcase on the bed and stands there. Waitin
Oh, hang on. She digs into her purse. All she has is twenties. She pee one off and holds it out.
If I could just get a little -- But before she can finish, he pockets it, nods and leaves closing the door behind him. To the closed door:

-- change. She pulls open the blinds, they fall off the wall with a CRASH! Ali stares at them. Then she opens the window. The SOUNDS OF HOLLYWOOD pour in. She digs out her cash, sticks it under the mattress. Then she reconsiders. 17. She removes the money, takes a Ziploc bag full of make-up from her purse, dumps the make-up onto the bed, seals the money up in the Ziploc, and takes it into: THE BATHROOM. She lifts the lid of the back toilet tank a slips the Ziploc of cash under it, catching the bag in th lid as she sets it back down, so it won't fall in. She goes back into the main room to find a CALICO CAT sit on the window sill. It MEOWS, hops into the room.
Hey. I thought this was a single. The cat curls up next to her. She checks his junk.
Typical. First guy I meet is neutered.
You don't happen to know anyone in the music business, do you?
Ali sips coffee from a paper cup as she reads TRADES and ADS spread over the floor. She refills the lid of the cup which the cat laps up.
Singer/Actress... Singer/Songwriter .Singer/Scuba diver? Perfect. ON ANOTHER AD: It says: "SINGER/WAITRESS WANTED." MUSIC U

Ali cruises toward the address, dressed in her Iowa best, full of confidence. She rounds a corner and sees: A LONG LINE OF 165 GORGEOUS, IMPECCABLY GROOMED GIRLS. Ali stops in her tracks. Tougher competition than she was expecting. She heads for the back of the line, passing gi doing vocal warm-ups. One girl is belting out a riveting "SOMEWHERE OVER THE RAINBOW". Just as Ali gets in line, t door opens and a SKINNY GUY sticks his head out.
Sorry, ladies, that's all the applications we're taking today. CLOSE ON: an ad: "DANCERS WANTED. PRETTY GIRLS ONLY." 18.
Ali circles the ad, sips coffee. Looks at the cat.
I can dance.
Ali breezes in-- SEES ...a bunch of stripper poles, seedy drunk guys in the audience. She PIVOTS, and walks right b out. As she leaves, a DRUNK GUY turns to A SEEDY GUY.
She'll be back.

Ali enters, full of energy, as 65 hot LATINA and AFRICAN- AMERICAN girls in butt-baring, hootchie, hip-hop garb, tu in unison and eye her, in her denim shorts and white platforms. Not her crowd. CLOSE ON: A PEN CIRCLES: "SINGER/DANCERS WANTED FOR TOUR.
Ali, eyeing the ad, sips a cup of coffee. Looks at the ca

Ali, dressed like the girls at the video audition: hootch street -- opens the door to find 30 CLASSICAL BUN-TOPPED BALLERINAS stretching, warming up. A Degas painting. They turn in unison and eye her. Again, not her crowd.
Gleaming in the California sunshine. Ali stares up at the glittering shrine to recording. Takes in the whole swirli crazy scene around her. 19.

Ali wanders down the sidewalk chugging an iced latte. The Strip hums with SLICK NIGHT LIFE. Expensive cars pull up valets. Hipsters swish past velvet ropes. Ali moves throu the throngs, alone, anonymous, invisible. She passes a CONSTRUCTION SITE for a 15-STORY-TALL BUILDI all lit up, guys working at night. A BUS pulls out, spewi exhaust. As the smoke clears, Ali sees, across the street A BEAUTIFUL, STATUESQUE GIRL standing on the landing of a fire escape under a street lamp beside a NONDESCRIPT CLUB Ali catches glimpses of her as the Sunset traffic whizzes full make-up, spangled burlesque costume, impossibly high heels, awesome. This is Coco. Coco makes the dirty streetlight look like a movie-quality Kleig. Everything a her shimmers. Intrigued, Ali looks for a break in the traffic and cross the street. As she nears the club, she hears a MAN'S VOIC

Like I said, LOOK BUT DON'T TOUCH! ALEXIS, drag queen/door whore, also in full costume and m up, TOSSES a GUY out the front door onto the street, then heads back inside-- Ali smiles to herself. Then turns back to look at COCO wh disappears inside a BACK DOOR as...NIKKI walks out. Light ciggie. She has on full make-up. Lacquered lips. Lashes l peacock feathers. She sees Ali staring.
Didn't your Mama tell you it's not polite to stare?
Sorry, you're just -- so DAMN beautiful.
In that case, screw your Mama, stare away. Nikki strikes a pose, campy, showing Ali her best side. T both laugh.
No one would ever guess. 20.
What?
That you're a dude. Nikki's face turns to stone. Her eyes widen in horror. Al sees the mistake she made. She's mortified.
Oh, shit.
"Shit's" right, you little half-wit
Nikki is about to unleash when the stage door opens.
Bitch! You're on! Sean grabs her and drags her inside. As he does, a STRAND CRYSTAL BEADS comes off her costume, falls to the ground.

I'm really sor-- The stage door slams shut. Ali picks up the strand of bea Holds them up in the light, watching them shimmer. She goes to the front of club, where a smattering of L.A. HIPSTERS enter. There's a GLASS DISPLAY CASE full of phot of the acts. Ali looks at the pictures of the Girls in th elaborate costumes and provocative poses. She's unintentionally made her way to the front door. Bla curtains obscure her view inside. She peers in. HEARS coo music emanating. The sounds of a nightclub. Intriguing. S ventures inside...

Ali MOVES down a DIMLY LIT HALLWAY. More beautiful photos women in elaborate costumes, drawings, sketches, painting clutter the walls. Ali follows the photos down the hallwa MUFFLED SOUNDS penetrate the darkness: people talking ove each other, glasses clinking. 1930's Berlin style music.
Alexis sits on a stool, glaring down at her. 21.
What is this place? A strip club?
Strip club? Honey, I ought to wash your mouth out with Jaegermeister. The only pole you'll find in here is Natasha the shot girl. Ali looks back at the photos.
Babycakes, shit or get off the throne, I got a club to fill here. Ali digs her ID out, hands it over. Alexis scans it --

Twenty bucks. Ali looks in her wallet. Sees one lone twenty inside. She hands it to Alexis. He nods for her to go ahead. Ali descends a staircase INTO THE CLUB... .and is BOMBARDED by: colors, chaos, laughter, scandal -- all shimmering, as if someone dunked the place in glitter And over it all, an incredible mash-up of old music with contemporary beat tying it all together. Ali ENTERS, rounds a pillar, staring out into the room as SPOTLIGHT finds the stage where half a dozen OSTRICH FANS

Smoother than honey and twice as sweet. Each girl lovelier then the next. Gentlemen, hold onto your hats. Ladies, hold on to your gentlemen. We may not have windows.. .but we DO have the best view on the Sunset Strip! MUSIC KICKS IN AS LIGHTS FLARE from the back of the stage where Three Girls stand, backs to the audience, Fosse-sty Coco, Georgia, and Nikki strut downstage. Behind them, Gi MOVE AND DANCE on cabaret chairs. Totally raunchy, comple timeless. 22. The girls hit the beats, turning upside-down on cabaret chairs, arched backs, legs reaching upward, bending over, asses to the audience, bodies writhing in air-tight choreography: thrusting hips, whipping heads, stomping fe Ali watches, exhilarated, as the music builds and SWELLS full on performance with the entire ensemble--
Get you a drink? She turns. A bartender is watching her watch. JACK - 25, punky, dark hair, eyeliner, one arm half-sleeved with tat
Only if you're buying.
(slides her a beer) Welcome to L.A.
Is it that obvious?
You still have that new-car smell.
Not brand new. But still under warranty.
Where you from? She looks back at the stage, mesmerized.
Iowa.
Oh, yeah? Kentucky. We're practically related.
I thought you looked familiar. He smiles. As Ali sips her free beer, Jack stacks drinks tray for a DITSY WAITRESS. He slides the tray to her. She doesn't notice. He barks at her:
Hey_. Go. 23. The Waitress picks up the tray -- almost spilling the dri - then heads off. Ali looks around the place-- wowed...
Damn...
They don't build 'em like this in Iowa, huh?
Hell no. I wouldn't have left. She stares up at the stage, marvels at the dancers.
So tell me -- who does a girl flirt with to get from here... (points to the stage) to there?
Is this you flirting?
With someone wearing more eyeliner than me? He laughs. Points across the club to A DOOR leading backstage.
Ask for Tess. She's your guy. Flirt away. As she heads off--
Hey, Iowa-- use my name. He hands her a card. She looks at it:
Thanks, Jack. She smiles, slips it in her cleavage and heads for the do
Ali enters into a frenzy. Legs, costumes, boobs, heels, eyeliners -- all flying around like a flock of birds. 24. In the middle of the maelstrom sits Tess, at a mirror, quietly applying lipstick.
Excuse me. I'm looking for Tess.

(glued to the mirror) So am I. And sometimes, when the lights are dim, and I squint my eyes ...I can still see her. She switches to mascara. Sean, arms heavy with corsets, catches eyes with Ali, nods toward Tess: "that's her." Al steps closer to Tess.
Hi. I'm a friend of Jack's, and I'm-
New in town.
Yes, and I'm--
Looking for a job.
Yes, and I--
Want to perform here.
Yes. Tess glances at Ali in the mirror. Then goes back to her mascara, unimpressed. Silence.
I'm a singer. A good one.
This is a dance show.
I can dance.
(a quick glance) Really? You a professional? 25.
I'm a quick study.
Not on my dime. Tess stands, a final check in the mirror. Ali sees her ch
Okay, I get that you're busy so I won't waste any more of your time-- but this place-- I've just never seen anything like it before and I know I belong here. So, how can I be a part of it?
Twenty bucks at the door can make all your dreams come true. Tess strides out, not looking back. Ali sees the Girls trading glances, amused. She turns and leaves.

The Bumper Band plays as Ali makes her way back toward th bar, dejected. Across the room, the Ditzy Waitress, holdi an empty tray, flirts with a table of YOUNG HIPSTER GUYS. Ali sees ANOTHER TABLE OF CHIC CLUBSTERS trying to get th waitress's attention. The Waitress ignores them. Ali sees the trays on the end of the bar. She grabs one, to the TABLE OF CLUBSTERS, clears their empties, takes th order. She finds Jack at the bar, unloads the empties.
One Dewar's neat, one shot of Patron, and get this, tough-guy in the hat? He wants a Cosmo. Jack looks at her, surprised. Impressed.
One night. If I'm not 20 times better than boobs-for-brains over there, you don't have to pay me.

weaving their way through the tables. WIDEN to see she no wears a Burlesque Lounge Cocktail Waitress get-up. She delivers a heavy tray to a table. She heads back to the bar with empties, eyes glued to the stage, where Coco and the GIRLS are dancing to "Wagon Whe Watusi." As Ali hits the bar, Coco nails a stunning kick.
Her leg went behind her head!
Yeah, Coco's the real deal.
I want to do that.
She used to dance with the Joffrey Ballet. Nikki sang opera. Eva performed with Cirque. Everyone here's a pro. (slides a tray of drinks) And you're on!
Nikki, lined up with the other girls, peers between the curtains, spots Ali serving the drinks to a table.
What's she doing here?!
I want that bitch out. Now.
What'd she do to you?
She thought I was a drag queen! Stifled giggles from the girls.

Can't be the first time THAT'S happened. Nikki is about to haul off on Sean when the CURTAIN OPENS and WHOOMP! 27. she turns, flashing her best stage smile as she joins Coc and the Girls onstage in the sexy, high-energy Fosse-styl "Wagon Wheel Watusi." From the floor, Ali serves drinks, takes care of customer all the while watching the spectacle on stage, mesmerized
The door opens. Ali enters, exhausted, but on Cloud 9, singing "TOUGH LOVER" to herself.
When he kisses me I get a thrill... The Cat MEOWS and slinks out from behind the bed. Ali pul the crystal beads out of her pocket
And when he does that wiggle I can't keep still (ties the beads around the
Cause he's a tough lover.. .

"Prince Nez" by Squirell Nut Zippers plays as Eva Destruction, dressed as a naughty-sexy ballerina, does a bawdy -- and technically flawless -- ballet number on a cabaret chair, on pointe. ON THE FLOOR, Ali delivers a tray of drinks to a table of MUSIC-INDUSTRY GUYS. One of them drops a bill on her tray
Thanks. She heads back to the bar. As Jack loads her tray up, she stuffs her tips into her pocket-- SEES Sean, looking her and down.
Okay, girl, time for Sean to give you a real tip. He ties her shirt up higher, undoes the top few buttons..

You got lips that could suck the chrome off a Peterbilt, but that matte is about as sexy as a bedpan. 28. As Sean wipes off Ali's lipstick, then whips out a tube o lip gloss and paints away, Jack and Ali share a smirk. Se steps back, assesses his work. Pleased.

Now baby, go show 'em what you got. He heads off. While Eva performs onstage, Ali delivers th drinks to a table of SCENESTERS as Eva winds up her act i flurry of fierce ballet moves, finishing to APPLAUSE as.. Ali notices someone waving her over. MARCUS GERBER. 31, boyishly handsome in jeans and a ringer tee. Gold Rolex, status sneakers. Charming. Charismatic. When Ali gets to him:
Dewar's on the rocks for me. Bottle of Dom for the table and-- (tosses a black AmEx on her tray, noticing her) --And tell Nikki I'm here. Ali starts away, then--
And you are?
(nods toward the card) A member since 1991. Oh-kay. He smiles, wickedly handsome. Ali pivots and head back to the bar. Before she can tell Jack the order:
Dewar's rocks, bottle of Dom, keep it coming.
So Asshole's a regular?
Marcus Gerber. Real estate guy.
He's with Nikki?
This week. Vince goes over to Marcus's table, shakes hands, joins hi 29.
Who's that with him?
Technically your boss: Vince Scali. Tess's partner. And ex... Jack is about to lift the AmEx off the tray, when Sean sw by and intercepts it.
A black AmEx! The backstage pass to life! He sees Coco walking by, swipes the AmEx in her cleavage. She shudders, then turns around and tips her ass up at hi He swipes the card again.
Access denied!
Now there's a first! Jack sees Ali laughing at their banter. She heads off wit the tray of Dewar's and Dom as the "Prince Nez" number en
LIGHTS UP on TESS, CENTER STAGE as she begins a new numbe "Long John Blues." A singing/spoken hilarious interlude. Girls back her up.

head_text.subj: I GOT A DENTIST, HE'S OVER SEVEN FEET TALL.
HIS NAME IS DR. LONG JOHN,
I WENT TO LONG JOHN'S OFFICE,
I SAID, "DOCTOR, THE PAIN IS KILLIN' ME."
IT'S JUST YOUR CAVITY, NEEDS A LITTLE FILLIN'.. .

text: As she continues... ON THE FLOOR, Nikki is sitting in Marcus's lap, nibbling neck. Vince sits down beside Marcus. Marcus pats Nikki on butt, excusing her. As she heads off:
She's on the verge. 30.
That's what you said last time.
She has no choice. We owe a balloon payment of 100 grand on the first, she took out a second to buy me out of the condo. And she just got turned down for another loan today.
There's a handful of these clubs around town, I could buy one of them tomorrow.
But it wouldn't be in the heart of the Sunset Strip. ON STAGE TESS AND THE GIRLS TOYING WITH THE AUDIENCE...

head_text.subj: HE SAID HE WOULDN'T HURT ME,
THEN HE FILLED MY HOLE INSIDE.
LONG JOHN, DON ' T YOU EVER GO AWAY.
CAUSE YOU THRILL ME WHEN YOU DRILL ME,
AND I DON'T NEED NO NOVOCAINE TODAY.
HE SAID IF IT EVER STARTS A'THROBBIN',
COME BACK AND SEE OL' LONG JOHN,
AGAIN, AND AGAIN, AND AGAIN AND AGAIN

text: A RIM-SHOT and BLAST from the band as the audience laughs From the stage, Tess notices Vince shake Marcus's hand an leave. A flicker of irritation-- nothing anyone in the audience would notice -- but it's there.
Ali brings a tray of empties over. Sean is there.
She's funny.

Thanks. My lines. Our secret. Jack gives Sean his drink. He walks off. MUSIC UP: An insanely cool version of Sly and Family Stone "Everybody Star" mashed up with a Fosse-esque Burlesque rap. 31. Jack notices Ali watching the stage... she lights up and melts, enraptured by the girls as they vamp to choreograp in a tight group.

Song CONTINUES over a SERIES OF SHOTS: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali plops down a bunch of BOOKS, OPE The Golden Age of Burlesque", lays on her bed, petting he cat with her foot. She locks in on a photo of 20's-era Burlesque dancers over which we HEAR--
IN THE CLUB, BURLESQUE GIRLS strike a similar pose
(WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

head_text.subj: ALI CHANNELING THE CHOREOGRAPHY AS SHE

text: - wipes down tables with Jack in the club after hours, - flips through old Soul records at a used LP store, - pokes her way through the scruffy street folks that han out by her hotel.
(WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)
ON ALI'S BED, Ali flips to a picture of Mae West IN THE CLUB, Tess cracks up the crowd
(WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali eats Chinese take-out as she por over the book. Turns the page to a photo of OLD SCHOOL ACROBATS over "Everybody Is A Star"... IN THE CLUB, Daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille nail an
(WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)
IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali, in the bath, still reading, tur the page to a gorgeous image of Josephine Baker

head_text.subj: EVERYBODY WANTS TO SHINE. OOH AND
COME OUT ON A CLOUDY DAY ...

text: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali vamps, dancing to the song in he room in a t-shirt and undies. The cat watches her, yawns and slinks away. IN THE CLUB, The Burlesque Girls thwack down on chairs.
(WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)
IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali thwacks down on an old mustard- colored chair.

head_text.subj: EVER CATCH A FALLIN STAR. AIN'T NO
STOPPING TIL IT'S IN THE GROUND...

text: IN THE CLUB, AN OVERHEAD SHOT, THE BURLESQUE GIRLS now in different costumes in a BUSBY BERKELEY cluster, AS CAMERA BOOMS DOWN ON THEM and they separate to reveal: ALI, center stage, belting UP AT CAMERA:

FIND Ali, in her waitress outfit, watching the girls on stage, lost in her fantasy. She catches herself, then mov along serving drinks while the Girls work the stage. The Burlesque Girls continue their Burlesque Rap. When th girls thrust out their hips in unison, Ali does too, unconsciously dancing along with them. AT THE BAR, Jack notices. Watches. Tries to focus on pour drinks, but his eyes keep drifting to Ali's hips. NEARBY, Sean notices Jack noticing. Looks from Jack to Al Eyebrow goes up. Interesting. 33.
Backstage mayhem. Girls scurry, Sean fusses, Tess sits at mirror, applying a fake eyelash as WE HEAR a surprisingly good woman's voice BELTING a SONG! It's Nikki. Late again
Nikki, do you even own a watch? Or do you measure time in Patron shots? Ali enters with a tray of drinks. Nikki swipes one.
Hey, no, that's for -- Nikki opens a bottle, pops 3 pills in her mouth, washes t down with the drink, and sets the empty glass on Ali's tr
You, I guess. Nikki turns to the mirror and starts getting to work. As hands out the other drinks:
Tess? Do you have a second? Tess doesn't answer. But a slight glance at Ali in the mirror shows she's half-listening.
I was thinking -- see, I grew up listening to all this music, I'd play the records over and over --
Fast-forward, babe. I gotta rebuild Rome in the next two minutes--
Now see-- that's what I've been thinking about. There's one thing I don't get.
Just one? 34.

It's the vocals. You have the girls lip-synching. which is fine, I guess, but wouldn't it be so much better if they actually sang? The Girls trade looks, knowing Ali's overstepping here. A doesn't feel the vibe-shift, surges ahead.
I've been reading up on it, and back when burlesque started, that's what they did. Silence. Nobody moves. All eyes on Tess.
Oh, no she didn't? Tess slowly spins around in her chair to face Ali. Peers her with a supercilious gaze.
"When burlesque started"? Which was...when?
(searching her memory) Oh. Well... this book said it came after...

Vaudeville -- is the word you're looking for. Derived from the 15th- century French expression "voix de ville" -- "voice of the city". Popular songs of the time that were strung together into stage shows. Which, over time, gave birth to another kind of show in which talented girls showing a bit more skin danced, did skits, and, _ yes, sang. In addition to being raunchier, these shows were funnier, hence the new name. "Burlesque": "comical" in French. Ali sees the Girls enjoying this dressing-down immensely. Tess stands, peers down her nose at Ali.
Dance major. Juilliard. I did my thesis on Burlesque. 35.
Oh. Ok. It's just-- It's just that ...I CAN sing and--

We can all sing. But they don't come to hear us sing. They come to see the best dancers in town backed by the greatest singers in history. (then, condescending) But tell you what: when you find someone with better pipes than Sarah Vaughn, Billie Holiday and Etta James-- you let me know. She sashays out leaving Ali standing there with what's le of her dignity and an empty cocktail tray. The Girls laun back into prepping for the show.
Ali pushes in, pissed off, and hears the sound of PUKING. She sees Georgia's BOOTS sticking out from under the stal
Georgia? You okay in there? A FLUSH. The stall door opens. Georgia comes out shakily with mascara-smudged eyes, sweet as ever.
I don't know why they call it morning sickness when it hits at every freakin hour of the day. She rinses her mouth out at the sink.
There aren't many women who could dance the Charleston on a chair at - - what are you, three months? Georgia turns sideways to the mirror, inspecting her bump
Four. Can you believe my boyfriend hasn't noticed yet?
You haven't told him? 36.
I guess as long as he doesn't know, I can still imagine he'll be happy about it. (looks in the mirror) Oh my God, look what the cat dragged in. She gets to work wiping away her smudged mascara.
You look pretty hot to me. Georgia reaches into her corset, yanks one breast skyward then does the same to the other.
Yeah, well -- you take what Mother Nature gave you and milk the hell out of it, right? Coco enters carrying a glass of tonic for Georgia.
Thanks, Coco.
Shouldn't you be on the floor?
I had to pee. Is that okay with you?
Not when you're blocking my mirror it's not. Ali sees she's in the way. As she steps aside:
(re. the music) That's us. You okay, or are you gonna puke on me during the number?
I can't make any promises. Coco drags her out, leaving Ali alone. Ali looks at herse in the mirror. Reaches into her shirt and does the boob-h that Georgia did. Looks again. Better. 37.
Ali trudges up the stairs, tired. Suddenly, TWO YOUNG THU barrel down the stairs, past her, almost knocking her ove
Hey! They tear past her. She shakes her head, reaches her landing, heads down the hall toward her room, then sees: HER HOTEL ROOM DOOR, ajar. The lock broken.
No. No! She runs down the hall.
Ransacked. Ali rushes in, goes straight into:
The lid is off the toilet tank. Her Ziploc of money is go
No!!! God damn it!!! She looks out the window, SEES the ROBBERS running off, disappearing down the street. She kicks the trash can. It flies across the room.
Damn it! Damn it, damn it, damn it, damn it, damn it! She sees the cat watching her from behind the bed.
A lotta help you were. The cat creeps out, slinks around her legs. Ali plunks on the bed.

Shit. Then she sees, on the floor, the PHOTO she took from Nann She picks it up. The glass has cracked, tearing the pictu 38. She takes the picture out of the broken frame, smooths it -- then looks around her trashed room. Fighting despair.

FOLLOW a motorcycle up the street. The DRIVER has a KEYBO on his back. He parks, gets off, takes off his helmet. It Jack. He heads for his apartment, but slows when he sees: ALI, sitting on his steps, her bags at her feet. Head low
Ali? What's wrong? You okay? She tries to speak, but can't -- so she just nods.
Really? Cause, in my experience-- when you're on someone's doorstep surrounded by everything you own, there's usually a not-so-good story
And as she expected, as soon as she talks, she starts to
Shit. No way!
(halting, gaspy sobs) Came in -- busted the lock-- and stole all my MO-NEY-EY-EY-EY!!! She sobs--trying to talk, with high-pitched SQUEAKS only heard by birds. Jack winces, trying to follow--

(more gaspy sobs) And there's no way I-- sleep there-- with-- like that-- the manager said- - not till Monday-- and I don't-- anyone else-- but then-- so I remembered I had...but it went straight to...so I... She reaches in her pocket, pulls out a card. It's Jack's he gave her in the club. It has his address on it. 39.
Okay. I have no idea what you just said, but come on in here and we'll get it sorted out. She looks at him. Wiping her tears. He picks up the heavi of her bags and leads her to:
Tiny one-bedroom. Very "done." Floral sofa. Curtains that match the area rug. Candle groupings.
Have a seat. I'll get us BOTH a drink. Here -- He hands her his phone. She looks at it.
-- call whoever you want, long- distance, whatever--
I can't.
Sure you can. Go ahead. Her chin starts quivering all over again.
I.. .don't ...have anyone.
What do you mean?
To call.
No parents? (she shakes her head) Siblings? Aunts? Uncles?
Friends?
No one! No one, okay? Do I have to spell it out for you? I am -- completely -- alone! 40. Jack susses out the situation.
So...you're not here to use my phone. She starts to cry again.

Okay. Wait. No, stop, stop, stop, it's okay, it's fine. You'll crash here. No problem. Just, please -- no more crying. She nods. He grabs a bottle of Tequila and a couple of glasses. Pours them a couple. They both take a drink.
Better? She nods.
Okay. Good. She wipes her eyes.
Just for one night, I swear. Just till it's light outside and I can figure out my next move.
Deal. Then she opens her small bag and the cat strolls out.
Whoa, whoa, you didn't say anything about a cat.
What? You don't like cats? It slinks around his leg. He shakes it off.
I hate cats.
How can you hate a cat? 41.
It's easy, I'll show you. The cat bolts into the bedroom.
Where's it going? If that thing pees on my bed --
He goes outside. We just have to open a window. He's very independent. She opens the window. The cat scurries back in, leaps ont the ledge. Ali pets him. Looks at Jack, smiles.
I don't have a name for him yet. It purrs. Jack eyes it warily.
One night?
One night.

IN THE LIVING ROOM, the lights are low. Ali's on the couc under covers, cat at her feet. INTERCUT WITH: THE BEDROOM. Jack at his keyboard, playing from sheet mus learning a song. When he pauses, from the living room:
You're good.
Thanks.
Why don't you play at the club?
Make more money bartending.
You in a band? 42.

Was... Guitarist moved to Reno, Drummer went to med school, bassist is in rehab. I'm subbing around town till I regroup. This is for a punk fusion band -- their keyboardist is a flake, so they call me a lot.
A flaky punk-rock-fusion keyboardist? No way. He smiles. Continues playing. HIGH ANGLE, seeing both of them on either side of a wall. Her listening, him playing. After a few measures:
Hey... He stops playing again.
Why'd you leave Kentucky?
Why'd you leave Iowa?
Cause I looked around and realized there wasn't one person whose life I wanted.
Exactly. A beat. Then as he starts playing again:
Hey Jack? He stops again.
Thank you. I'm really glad I'm not alone tonight. He smiles.
Get some sleep. 43. He continues playing. She closes her eyes.
Light rain on the window. CLOSE ON: THE CAT'S FACE, staring right into camera. REVERSE ON: Jack, waking up. As his eyes open, the Cat li him on the mouth.
Aauuuugggghh. He hurls the cat away and bolts out of bed, disgusted.

Jack straggles in, wiping his mouth. The sofa's made up, blankets folded. Ali is making breakfast, her back to him He can't help but notice she's only wearing a tiny tank t and undies. She hears him clear his throat.
Morning. Coffee?
Black. Like my soul. She pours him a cup. Sees a picture of a BEAUTIFUL GIRL o his fridge.
She's pretty. Your sister?
My fiancee. Natalie.
Fiancee? You're straight?
Of course I'm straight. You thought I was gay?
Yes?
Why? 44.
I don't know, the...make-up?
It's a look.
Okay.
A straight look.
Okay.
And the floral couch...?
Natalie. As Ali realizes she's barely dressed in front of a straig guy.
I should put on pants.
Probably. She bolts out to the living room, starts digging through bag, bent over. She's in the doorway, so from the kitchen all he can see is her cute little ass sticking out.
Where is she?
New York. Doing a play.
For how long?
Six more weeks. She can't find pants. She shifts, so now her ass is facin him directly. He tries not to look--
Oh, God, now I feel bad about this.
For what?
I don't know. Now that you're straight and engaged, it feels weird that I came here.
Well, you did, and it was fine. Aha! Pants. She pulls them out, starts putting them on. H looks out. Her foot is caught in the pants leg. As she ho around, trying to untangle it--
Or at least it will be as soon as you get dressed. She tumbles out of view, thumps against some furniture. She appears in the doorway, pants on, pulling on a sweate She slips her feet into her shoes.
Alrighty then-- I'll get outta your hair now...
Wait, where're you headed?
Oh, don't worry about me. I've got a plan. (scoops up the cat) Come on, cat. She zips the cat into the bag he came in.
Hang on, let me at least spot you some cash. I'm a little strapped, but I could --
No, I'm good, if you could just She nods at the door. He opens it for her.
Thank you. For everything. You are my knight in shining... eyeliner.
(out the door) I'll see you at the club.
Cool. She leaves. He closes the door behind her. Stands there.
Ali looks at the rain. Then marches out into it, lugging stuff. Goes about 15 yards in one direction, then stops.
Jack watches her out the window as she marches 15 yards i another direction, then stops. Pondering. She sees a bus stop across the street. She crosses to it and sits.
Ali peers down the street for the bus. Jack appears besid her, getting soaked in the rain.
So, this plan of yours?
.was to sit here at the bus stop and come up with a plan.
Come back inside.
No, Jack, I--
I'll figure it out, this is not
It's pouring!
It's only water for chrissakes-- 47.
Jack-- you've done enough and-- In ONE MOVE he SCOOPS HER up as she lets out a WHOOOOP!
Jack-- No! Stop it! He grabs her bags and carries her back across the street-
The DOOR KICKS OPEN-- they ENTER, Jack carrying Ali, drip wet.
He sets her down--
Look, you have nowhere to go, I have a couch. You may as well stay here for a few days.
You really don't need to do that. I'll be fine --
You'll be homeless. You always have this much trouble saying yes when someone is trying to help you?
It's never happened before. The Cat jumps up on the back of a chair, all wet, and SHA splattering them with wet cat smell.
Aaaaargh! As his PHONE RINGS.
There's a towel in the bathroom-- dry yourself and that damn cat off. 48. Ali collects the cat-- heads for the bathroom. Jack check his phone. Answers.
Hey, baby, how's it going?... Really? That's awesome...

head_text.subj: DO YOU HAVE A BLOW DRYER

text: That...? Just this person from work What? No, she's just a friend, I'm helping her out. Nat, it's nothing. O.S. MUSIC UP: "BABY YOU'VE GOT WHAT IT TAKES" by Brook Denton and Dinah Washington over...

CLOSE ON A HEAVILY MADE-UP GIRL as she screams and drops of the shot in a flying split. Behind her, a ROW OF DANCE do the same. Typical, fantastic, old-school can-can. WIDEN to see Tess and Sean, on the floor, auditioning the The club is brightly lit, none of its evening aura. Scattered around the club are other HOPEFULS in groups, waiting for their turn.
Jack's motorcycle pulls up to the club, with Jack driving and Ali riding on back.

Ali and Jack enter as the auditions are under way. As the set up the bar, Ali watches the stage, intrigued. MONTAGE: the dancers auditioning, in small groups. All shapes, sizes. Ali watching. Finally only a few are left. 49.
Okay, front row, thank you very much. They walk off stage, dismissed. Tess turns to Sean.
What happened to all the great dancers in L.A?

They're busy "Dancing with the Stars." (to the waiting dancers) Last group, please. HALF A DOZEN DANCERS move to the stage. Ali watches from behind the bar, thinking. Then, on her face, we see: an i forming. ON THE FLOOR, Tess and Sean check their clipboards, organizing for this next set. They look up and start in:
All right, ladies, and five, six, seven -- whoa. There, in the back row, is Ali, in her white platform sho
What the hell do you think you're doing? Coco and Georgia ENTER-- surprised to see Ali on stage.
Trying out.
I don't think so.
Tess, I've been singing and dancing my whole life and--
The girls here have years of training and experience. This stage is for serious and professional
(angry, interrupting) Hey_. This is your club and you can be as rude as you want--but don't you dare tell me I'm not serious. Sean's eyebrows reach for the ceiling as Nikki enters, SE Ali on stage.

I may not have been to a professional dance school, but I have a lot of talent and I came to this town to do something with it. And the only reason I've been putting up with all the bullshit "attitude" I get from you is cause I want to do it here.

For the first time in my life, I don't want to be someplace else. So you're gonna give me MY shot. Right here. Right now. Everyone in the club just stands there. Jaws dropped. Tes just looks at her, blinks, incredulous.
One song. You don't like it, I'll quit and do us both a favor.
Your call, lady. I know every number in the show. Sean, eyes big as saucers, looks from Ali to Tess, then b
You know every number.
Which one do you wanna see? Tess looks at her in disbelief.
I said, which one do you wanna see? Ali just stares at her. Calling her bluff, Tess yells up DAVE in the sound booth-- 51.

Tough Lover! Tess plops down in a booth-- crosses her arms indignantly ON STAGE, the music starts. Ali readies herself, starts t dance. Behind a beat to two. She's got the steps right, b it isn't clicking. She's thinking too hard. No personalit After a few measures, Tess has seen enough.
Okay then, next?
Hang on. (to Dave in the booth) Start it again, please? As Dave resets the music. Ali regroups: takes her hair do and shakes it loose. Nikki ENTERS, SEES Ali on stage--
What the hell's going on?
Shhhh. On stage, Ali takes a beat; inhales, breathing in attitud Then she looks up at the booth again.

Anytime. The MUSIC starts in again. And this time, Ali comes alive She may not have perfect technique or the best extension, she exudes an ambition and sexuality no one has seen from before. It's like she becomes a woman before our eyes. Sh misses a step or two, but who the hell cares? On the floor, Sean gapes, eyes popping. Tess is poker-fac Coco and Georgia's expressions turn from dubious to respectful. Nikki's eyes narrow. At the bar, Jack freezes, a huge rack of glasses in his a - unable to tear his eyes away. 52. As the SONG CLIMAXES, Ali finishes with an alluring toss her ass, then lands in a sexy layout on a chair, owning t stage. The music ends. A stunned silence. The only sound is Ali's heavy breathing. Then Georgia jumps up, APPLAUDING EFFUSIVELY.
What are so you happy about, that's your replacement.
Yeah, but she's really good. Tess and Ali are in a stare down.
I want so badly to say something bitchy, but nothing's coming.
There's a first. Tess sighs, not wanting to give Ali any props.
You were off the whole second half.

So, I was spot on the first half? Tess narrows her eyes at Ali. Then looks over at Nikki, C and Georgia. Georgia gives an effusive THUMBS UP-- then suddenly becomes overcome by nausea, covers her mouth and RUNS to the bathroom to puke-- Tess rolls her eyes, looks back at Ali.
Oh, you're gonna be such a pain in my ass. Ali tries hard not to beam--
Do I have the job, or not?
You're not great. What you are is lucky. Because I need someone tonight. 53.
And I know all the routines. As Tess turns and leaves--
Even in those shoes that time forgot.
Theeeere's bitchy. Nikki watches Tess go-- turns and pours herself a shot.
Well-- this totally sucks ass. Sean jumps up on the stage.
Congratulations. The last time someone showed Tess balls like that, she married him. (looks Ali over) You look like a checker at a Mal Wart in Wichita. Just tripled your salary. Get a new look.
Hey, I happen to like the way I look.
Really? That's a fascinating story. And then what happens?
Backstage in five.
Welcome to the family. Ali jumps off the stage, runs to the bar, where Jack is s standing, slack-jawed. She throws her arms around him.

Sorry for the short notice, I quit! (plants a big kiss on him) But hey-- with my raise I'll be off your couch in a week. She squeezes him tight-- then heads backstage leaving him standing there, really turned on. 54.
Sean swings open A DOOR, revealing a room packed to the g with costumes: feathers, sequins, fishnets, corsets, jamm up against each other. Sean tosses her clothes in a blur.
First number, second number, third number... She catches the clothes. He dumps shoes on top of them, holding them up as he tells her what they go with:
With the sequined bustier. With the shorts and garters. With the beaded number. And those -- (points to hers) I never want to see again.
Oh! And -- He hands her a prop GOLD MACHINE GUN.
For "Miss Otis Regrets". Just be sure you don't -- Ali pulls the trigger. BOOM -- GLITTER SPLATS all over Se
Pull the trigger.

The chic audience watches the Girls doing a swingin' sixt shimmy and shake number. CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the girls' faces as drums roll and their heads turn to each drumbeat The last face to turn is ALI'S. In FULL STAGE MAKE-UP, sh looks like a gorgeous classic burlesque dancer. The girls in 20's revealing bathing suits and stilettos, kick and d downstage in a line. Ali struggles a little to keep up A WAITER CROSSES FRAME and we WIPE TO: - ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, different costumes. Ali's dancing is improving. WAITRESS CROSSES FRAME and we WIPE 55. - ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, yet another set of costumes. Ali's as good as anyone else up there. AN AUDIENCE MEMBER crosses frame and we WIPE TO: - ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, another set of costumes. Ali knows the steps now, she's not thinking about them. She's all performance, vamping to the audience, selling like cr She NAILS a final layout on a chair, it's flawless. Tess and Sean are watching from the wings. They notice th extra whip in Ali's head, the bump in her grind.
Admit it. You like her. It kills you, but you like her. Tess meets his eye, then walks away. The number ends. The girls rush offstage and peel their costumes off.
My tits are up around my ears, my thong's about a mile up up ass, this corset is so tight, I haven't breathed since Tuesday and these lashes are thick enough to kick up a stiff wind.
It's fun being a girl, huh?
Yeah. She hands him the last bits of her costume. FOLLOW Ali as she heads to the dressing room. As she grab her T-shirt and jeans:

I'm starving, who wants to go grab some pizza before the next show? A general chorus of "Yeah?" and "I'm in." FOLLOW Ali to the bathroom as she throws on her clothes a washes off her make-up, humming "Rich Man's Frug" to hers She heads back out to the dressing room to find: EVERYONE IS GONE. She looks around. Feels like an fool. She plunks down in a chair. Drops her bag on the floor. Looks at herself in the mirror. 56. She sees a picture of A CLASSIC BURLESQUE BEAUTY taped to mirror. Notices her eye make-up -- strong, thick eyeliner Ali picks up a brush, dips it in eyeliner, and tries to duplicate the look on her own eye. After a first try:
Your brush is for shit. She turns and sees Tess in the doorway. Tess comes over, takes Ali's brush. Looks at it.
Where'd you get this, the 99 cent store? She chucks it in the trash.
Hey.
Make-up is like wine. The good stuff costs a fortune but is worth every penny. Where is everyone?
All the girls went out for pizza.
Aren't you one of the girls?
Apparently not. Tess reads her like a book. Knows what went down. She tur to leave, then pauses at the door. Turns back.
Don't take it personally. Their love's the kind you gotta earn. Ali meets her eyes in the mirror. Then Tess grabs a brush from her own station, tosses it to Ali.
Dip it in water first, or you'll never get a clean line. She leaves Ali alone. 57.
Jack enters in boxers, kicks them off, opens the shower, freezes.
Ali is just waking up.
Your stupid cat peed in the tub!
What...? (sees the window closed) You closed the window, what do you expect?
Your cat pees in the house, and it's my_ fault?! Ali scoops the cat up.
Awwww. Poor guy, you must have been desperate.
Goddamn cat. And you used my towel again. (then, pointed) How's that apartment hunting coming? He GRABS the newspaper and tosses it in front of her-- sh glares at him, then glances at the paper--
A thousand bucks for a studio?
Can you really put a price on privacy? Freedom? Your own bathroom? With clean towels? 58.
Okay, Jack-- I get it-- His cell phone rings. As he checks who's calling:
Natalie. (then, into phone:) Hey, baby, how are you? He heads into the bedroom, closes the door. Ali shakes he head, begins to peruse the classifieds.
Ali, in pajamas, is at the table, combing the classified apartment ads. The cat is beside her.
Guest studio, Hollywood, $900, with a yard, and -- oh. No pets. (to the cat) Screw them. She scans the ads some more. Finds a good one.
Ooh? Jack walks in. Looks like he's got something on his mind.
I think I found my new place. Where's Pomona?
Go to Hell, turn left, it's three miles down on the right.
Really. How's Beachwood Canyon?
Great, if you have a car.

Would've been rude not to, right? You'd like those guys. Greg's the entertainment editor at the Times, and Marla's a designer. Ali glances back at Marla again, locks in on her shoes. AL I
I'm gonna dream about those shoes. MARCUS
Thousand dollars a pop. AL I
Jesus. Who can afford that? 84. MARCUS
I can. ALI

Hey, I saw them first. He laughs as they reach the top of the stairs and a BREATHTAKING PANORAMIC VIEW OF THE ENTIRE CITY is reveale Ali pauses, taking in the glittering, massive view of L.A ALI (CONT'D)
Whoa. L.A. looks one hell of a lot prettier from up here. MARCUS
It should. That view cost me three times what the house did. (POINTING)
See that strip mall down there? ALI
You own that too? MARCUS
No. I own everything above it. ALI
There is nothing above it. MARCUS
Exactly. ALI
You own...air? MARCUS

Air rights. The guy who owns the strip mall was having money issues and almost had to sell. Whoever he sold to would have put in a huge tower. So I bought the air rights. Now no one can ever build above one story. ALI
Aren't you the sly puss. MARCUS
Mall guy gets to keep his property. I get to keep the second best view in L.A. 85. ALI
What's the first? He gazes at her. She rolls her eyes. ALI (CONT'D)
How many girls have you used that on? MARCUS
None who ever called me on it. He smiles. Looks at her. Then... MARCUS (CONT'D)
What do you want, Ali? In life. Girl like you, gives up everything, gets on a bus heading for total uncertainty-- she's got a dream. I want to know what it is. ALI
Why? MARCUS
Because you're talented enough to get whatever you want. And I'm smart enough to help make it happen. So? What do you want? A beat. She thinks about it. Looks him in the eye. ALI
I want to be the best singer I can be. I want to give as much joy as I get when I perform. And I want to die knowing I made the most of every opportunity life gave me. MARCUS
That's ...so beautiful. AL I
There wasn't a dry eye in the house when I said it at the Grundy County Junior Miss Talent Show. His eyes narrow. MARCUS
Why do you women always take advantage of nice boys? 86. ALI
Oh, please. You are SO not a nice boy. He clinks her glass. Smiles at her. Devilish and sexy.

Party's over. Lights low. Ali walks through the almost- empty house, passes a COUPLE making out on a couch, a GUY holds out a joint. She motions "no thanks", heads into th LIVING ROOM, where Marcus is asleep on a Bertolli chair, drink in hand. An OLDER GUY is playing the piano quietly. Ali takes the drink from Marcus's hand, sets it on the ta She hears the pianist start a new song: (TBD). She smiles Goes over to him. ALI

Ooh, I love this song. The Piano Player scoots to make room. She sits beside him starts humming along. She does too. Then he sings a line. She sings one back. And they fall in together. Not vampin not performing. Just feeling the beauty of the music in t middle of the night.
Jack quietly lets himself in. He sets his keyboard down, sees the bedroom door cracked, the light on. JACK
Ali? He looks in. Empty. He checks the clock: 4:45. He hears a "meow", and sees the cat. He picks it up, turns out the light, and leaves the room.
Sean, Coco, Nikki, Jesse, and the rest of the girls in ea stages of getting ready. Ali enters. COCO
Someone has a package! Ali sees A GIFT BOX at her station. She reads the card: " saw them first." She opens the box and sees the Louboutin 87. JESSE
Ooh. Faboo. Nikki picks one up -- checking their authenticity. NIKKI
Who's the sucker? All eyes turn to Ali. She's saved by Tess entering. TESS
Coco-puff, shake a leg, you're on in five, Georgie-Girl, Ali-Cat -- move, move, move -- Tess exits. ALI
Ahh. My Nanna used to call me her Ali-Cat. SEAN
Yet another fascinating story. NIKKI
Why doesn't Tess have a nickname for me? COCO
Oh, she does. A knowing look amongst the girls. NIKKI
She never uses it. SEAN
Sure she does. NIKKI
When? SEAN
Just after you leave the room. Nikki gives him the finger and walks out. A beat. Then: GIRLS TOGETHER
Coke-whore. They crack up. CUE MUSIC: "STRANGE THINGS HAPPENING" 88.

Ali and the Burlesque Girls vamp forward and perform "STR THINGS HAPPENING", a decadent, rockin' dance/singing numb Scantily-clad girls pose and dance on chairs with images projected onto them -- a rock fantasy with burlesque move (like Bob Fosse's "All That Jazz") ALI

I got a ride home with that guy-- Marcus-- we went to a party. It was fun. JACK
Marcus the Asshole? ALI
Yeah. Turns out he's not so bad. She heads past him, toward the kitchen. He notices: JACK
New shoes?

text: Ali getting dressed to go out. She's wearing the Loubouti crossing back and forth in front of Jack, who's on the so JACK
There's only one reason a man buys a woman shoes, you know. ALI
So what if I'm getting a little male attention. JACK
You get a lot more than a little. ALI
Not from anyone who matters. JACK (CLEARLY IRRITATED)
I just think that you should be careful. Ali stops in front of him. Hands on her hips. AL I
And I just think that -- if you really feel the need to tell a girl what she should and shouldn't do, you should pick up the phone and call your fiancee.

text: After she passes... Jack's eyes open.
Ali, owning the stage and the room. ALI (CONT'D)

The SONG ENDS in a flourish. There's a CAMERA FLASH! FREEZE FRAME on the image: ALI, belting onstage, with the Burlesque Girls striking a pose behind her. WIDEN to see it's a photo on the front page of the L.A. T Calendar section. The headline: "BURLESQUE HAS A VOICE:".
Jack, sleepy, in boxers, stares at the newspaper, bewilde JACK
Hey. Have you seen this? ALI
What? Ali wanders out of the bathroom, brushing her teeth. He shows her the paper. She SCREAMS.
The Burlesque Girls (minus Ali) crowd around the paper. NIKKI
That's bullshit. 92. SCARLETT
No. That's major. NIKKI

(pointing to photo) Look again. The only thing major is the size of your ass. Nikki walks off-- Scarlett pick up the paper, looks close Ali enters, dance bag over her shoulder, running late. Th Burlesque Girls and Sean all APPLAUD (except Nikki) Ali smiles. Embarrassed. She curtsies sarcastically. Coco points to a BOUQUET OF ROSES at Ali's station. COCO
From Monsieur Louboutin, I presume. Ali reads the card: "To the best view in L.A. - M". Sean shoves her down in her seat, pulls her coat off. SEAN
Shake your tail, Alicat, you still got a show to do.
A PACKED LINE of chattering hipsters snakes down the bloc
MUSIC)

Daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille, in striped stockings corsets, and tons of cleavage, swing on a trapeze over th audience. Playing the comedy, grabbing each other in all right places. Classic Burlesque, unusually bawdy. Equally suggestive, funny, and skillful. Tess, all dolled-up, weaves through the tables, greeting, welcoming, reveling in the crowd. FIND Ali as she strides over to Marcus's booth. He stands hands her a glass of champagne. MARCUS
To the girl of the hour. 93. ALI
I'm starting to think you'll go to any length. MARCUS (INNOCENTLY)
I just made a call to Greg at the Times. ALI
Well-- I appreciate the kudos. (re: crowded room) And Tess appreciates the business. MARCUS
This has NOTHING to do with Tess. This is about you. And me. ALI
You are so full of it. He laughs-- takes her arm-- MARCUS
I've got another friend I want you to meet. She sees HAROLD SAINT sitting in the booth. He's in his 60's, still dressing like Robert Evans in his heyday. MARCUS (CONT'D)
Ali Rose, Harold Saint. ALI (SHOCKED)
Harold Saint? Shut up. You worked with Etta James. HAROLD
Her, she chewed me up and spat me out, that one. But with her voice, I forgive her everything. (THEN)
You got a set of pipes on you, too, little girl. I like your sound. ALI
Thank you. (SMILES)
I like yours. HAROLD
You ever recorded? 94. ALI
Not yet. HAROLD
We should do something about that. He stands. Turns to Marcus. HAROLD (CONT'D)
See you round, kiddo. He points his finger, gun-style, which would seem cheesy, he's old school, so instead it's weirdly cool. He leaves. ALI
Holy shit. Harold Saint. AT THE BAR, Jack watches Ali and Marcus talking excitedly Not liking what he sees. Sean breezes by, grabs a drink. SEAN
You snooze, you lose, pretty boy.
Sean grips the drink in his teeth as he bustles through t backstage, gathering costumes. He passes Tess going the o way. TESS
Can you believe this crowd? He dumps the costumes in her arms. SEAN

'bout time. These poor babies are begging for your glue-gun. Tess walks off with the armful of clothes, so happy, humm to herself, passes her OFFICE-- OPENS the door to SEE-- VINCE is sitting at her desk. He flinches at the sight of TESS

Can you believe the crowd out there? Never thought I'd see- She stops in her tracks, spotting Vince's PANTS on the FL and a TRAIL OF WOMEN'S CLOTHES to... THE NEW COCKTAIL WAITRESS, peering out, half-dressed, fro behind the curtains-- 95. TESS (CONT'D) (DISGUSTED)
In my god damn office? She shakes her head-- GRABS HER PURSE-- and walks out.
Tess, pissed off, carries the damaged costumes out to her car. Nikki is behind her, following her out. NIKKI
Tess. We need to talk. Tess rolls her eyes, doesn't slow. TESS
Not now, Nikki. NIKKI
Yes, now. I've been here since the beginning. We built this club together. And then some girl shows up out of nowhere-- who hasn't even paid her dues-- TESS
I'll get her to write a check tomorrow. NIKKI
And suddenly it's her show? TESS
No, it's not her show. It's my show. But people want to hear her sing. She's bringing them in off the streets. You better believe I'm building a show around her! NIKKI
I can sing too! And you know it. But you don't give a shit. You always say this is a dance troupe, now suddenly it's not? TESS NIKKI--
NIKKI
And you expect me to dance behind a girl who struts in with a new pair of shoes she got for sleeping with Marcus Gerber? TESS
(unlocking her car) Nikki, you're wasted. Go home. NIKKI
I won't be upstaged by some slut with mutant lungs! Tess hurls the costumes in the trunk of her car, furious. TESS
So don't be! Leave! If you don't want to be a part of what's happening here, then I don't want you around. NIKKI (AGHASST)
You'd destroy our friendship and break up the group over some girl you barely know? TESS

Since when do you care about friendship? Or this group? You're a trainwreck, Nikki! You put tequila on your breakfast cereal! I'm struggling to survive here, and you show up too drunk to dance! You call that loyalty? Nikki just looks at her-- NIKKI
Okay, then. I quit! Nikki stomps off. Tess sighs -- TESS NIKKI-- WAIT-- NIKKI
Marcus says you're losing the club anyway! (MOCKING HER)
"They don't come to hear us sing" (MORE)
NIKKI (CONT'D) (SOTTO)
Stupid bitch. Nikki flips her off and keeps walking. Then turns once mo NIKKI (CONT'D)

By the way: I slept with Vince the day after your honeymoon. Tess's eyes narrow. She grabs a HIGH-HEELED PUMP and HURL it. It flies through the air and hits Nikki in the back o the head. Nikki SCREAMS, whips around, incredulous, to se TESS, running right at her. Nikki bolts, heading for her car. She jumps in, locks the door just as Tess SMASHES he fist on the window and KICKS the door. Nikki starts the c NIKKI (CONT'D)
You crazy bitch! Nikki screeches off, leaving Tess alone in the parking lo Tess stands there a moment, then HEADS back into the club
The club is totally empty. Everyone is gone. Tess ENTERS, GRABS her bag as she spots a cabaret chair lying on it's on stage. She crosses onto the stage. Picks up the chair as...
Night, Tess. Tess looks up, Dave is closing up the sound booth. TESS

Night, Dave. Dave FLIPS a big lever, and almost all the lights go OUT, leaving one shaft of light across the stage. We HEAR Dave leave, as the street door closes shut. Tess alone on stag BEGIN TESS SOLO SONG NUMBER. TO BE WRITTEN.

Ali enters quietly, all dressed up. She slips off her hee and tiptoes to the bedroom. She slowly opens the bedroom door, then stops when she sees: 98. JACK, asleep in the bed. Ali looks at him, then looks at couch. Empty. She closes the door, fluffs the pillow, lie down on the couch, and pulls the blankets up over her. She lies in the darkness. PUSH THROUGH the wall to see Ja lying awake in the bed, the cat on his lap.

head_text.subj: THE SOUND OF A COFFEE GRINDER

text: CLOSE ON Ali, sleeping on the sofa-- abruptly wakes to th deafening grinding of coffee. She gets up, drags herself the kitchen. Sees Jack, grinding the coffee way longer th is necessary. ALI
You really need to do that at 6 in the morning? He turns, sees her. JACK
Little overdressed for breakfast. ALI
My pajamas were in my bedroom. Which was occupied. JACK
Well, you're never here so... it's stupid for me to crash on the couch every night when there's a perfectly good empty bed. Jack grinds the coffee beans again. Ali winces. ALI
So -- you want the bedroom back? Is that what you're saying? JACK
The bed should be used by someone. ALI
Hey, I'm home every night. Maybe not when you think I should be, but last I checked, you were my roommate, not my mother. (MORE) 99 ALI (CONT'D)
However, since it's an issue, what the hell, take the bed, I'll sleep on the sofa. I don't care. JACK
Fine. ALI
Fine. JACK
You'll have to move all your shit. ALI
I realize that. JACK
Cause the room's a total mess -- ALI
I'll move my stuff, God -- JACK
Clothes, make-up, shoes, hair things. ALI
Jesus, Jack, what is your problem? Ever since I started hanging out with Marcus, you've been acting like a class-A prick. Is there something you want to say? JACK
What? No. What do I care? You're ambitious, he can make things happen, go ahead, make a deal with the devil, what's it to me? ALI
First of all: He's not the devil. He's a smart businessman. And oddly enough-- a gentleman. (JACK SCOFFS)

Second: I'm gonna take the couch, and you're gonna 86 the attitude. Or I'm finding another place to live. She storms out of the kitchen, tripping over the cat-- a MEOW! as the cat scurries away, Jack intercepting him-- JACK
And try not to kill the cat! 100. A SLAM of the bedroom door. MUSIC UP: INSTRUMENTAL to "BA IT'S YOUR by The Shirelles.

CLOSE ON: A DIAMOND RING as it's placed on the hand of A VERY PREGNANT GEORGIA. Wearing an adorable mini-skirt maternity wedding dress. She looks at DAMON with devotion Ali, Tess, Coco, Sean and Jack, all watching the ceremony Ali looks over at Jack. He looks at her, then away.

The reception is underway. GUESTS are drinking, dancing w the iconic backdrop of Hollywood behind them. Ali, Sean, Coco and Tess stand together drinking, overlooking the ci ACROSS THE TERRACE, Jack is talking on his cell phone. JACK

What do you mean, you're still in New York? ...So you just -- decided not to come? You think you might've wanted to, I don't know, let me know??? We haven't seen each other in six months. ACROSS THE TERRACE, Ali sees Jack yelling into his phone. Sean sees her watching.
JACK (CONT'D)
.why does every conversation we have end up being about YOUR future... Jack looks across the terrace at Ali. Moonlight on her shoulders. A breeze in her hair. JACK (CONT'D)

.you know what, you're right. We both should be thinking about our futures. And I might just be looking at mine right now. Break a leg baby. Jack hangs up with finality and marches toward the bar-- cell phone immediately rings again. 101
He sees it's Natalie, sends it to voicemail, and shuts of his phone. As he PASSES Sean and Coco-- JACK (CONT'D)
I guess Natalie's not coming after all. SEAN

Oh, please, that girl? Show up at a party where she's not the center of attention? AT THE BAR - LATER - Jack drains one drink and orders another, getting very drunk. Ali sidles up to the bar. ALI (TO BARTENDER)
Shot of Patron. Jack raises his brow. Ali drinks the shot, and without looking at him-- ALI (CONT'D)
Lookin' kinda lonely. JACK (BOOZEY)
No. Not lonely. Liberated, yes. Libated, absolutely. But never lonely. Cheers, baby-- He raises his glass-- she rolls her eyes, walks off-- he follows her, playfully PUSHING her from behind. ALI
Hey-- what're we, in junior high? JACK
You still mad at me, Iowa? C'mon. Bring it on. She starts to say something as-- THE SHIRELLES start to s "BABY IT'S YOU"-- Jack turns to the DJ, points both finge at him and YELLS: JACK (CONT'D)

Everyone stares at the drunk guy. Ali rolls her eyes and walks off-- Jack swings her around, PULLING her close-- s just looks at him. Starts to laugh at how drunk he is-- J wraps her in his arms and starts to sing quietly in her e 102. JACK (CONT'D)
.Many many many nights go by, I sit alone, at home and cry, over you... ALI
Well, you're quite the crooner. He looks her in the eye. JACK
I'm sorry for being a class A prick. Ali smiles, surprised at his candor. He breathes a sigh o relief. JACK (CONT'D)
And as of about... (bleary look at his watch, CAN'T FOCUS)
.some time ago, I am officially a single man. ALI
You and Natalie split up? JACK
That we did. So. That explains what I'm doing here all alone. What are you doing here all alone? ALI

Do I look alone to you? They share a look. Then he spins her around in his arms. laughs. AT THE BAR, tipsy Sean and Coco stand side-by-side. Coco watching the DJ spin. The DJ glances down at them. COCO
That DJ's hot. SEAN
You think? COCO
He keeps looking at me. Coco smiles up at him, flirty. The DJ smiles back. 103. COCO (CONT'D)
Hmmm...I think he's cuckoo for Coco- puffs. They look at each other, then crack up like giggling schoolgirls.
CLOSE ON: A KEY TRYING TO GO INTO A LOCK. Then it disappe from view. We hear it CLANK to the ground. Then giggles.
Whoopsie daisy -- PULL BACK to find Jack and Ali, drunk, staring at the key the ground. JACK
Whoopsie daisy? ALI
My Nanna used to say that all the time. That and upsie jumpsie. JACK
Upsie jumpsie? (running it together) Upsie jumpsie, whoopsie daisy, upsie jumpsie, whoopsie daisy, upsie jumpsie -- (ABRUPTLY STOPS)
When would she say that? ALI
When she wanted her dog to get on the bed with her. That is -- (DRUNKEN WHISPER)
when she was alive. Their eyes meet. A connection. Then, staring into her eye JACK
(trying to be serious) The dog, or Nanna? Ali bursts out laughing. So does Jack, as he pushes the d open, and they fall into the apartment. 104.

Jack and Ali stumble in, Jack knocks the lamp over trying turn on the light. It BREAKS. Ali giggles as she plops do on the couch, struggling to take off her leather boot. No luck. She holds her legs out. ALI

Help me. Jack gets the lamp to standing, then grabs one of Ali's boots, slides it off, dumps it. Then he tries the second it sticks -- he pulls harder -- the boot pops off and he careens backwards, crashing into the lamp, knocking it ov again. Ali cracks up. He turns to the lamp. JACK
(like to a dog) Stay. He turns back to Ali, regains composure, bows JACK (CONT'D)
Good night. He backs away, into the bedroom. Ali looks confused. ALI
Oh. Okay. (BEAT)

Good night. Jack disappears into the bedroom and closes the door. Ali stares at it, surprised. Then resigned. Oh, well. She undoes her bra, threads it through her top and out the ar Then Jack's door opens. He stands in the doorway in match "Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer" pajamas, leaning against doorframe like Hugh Hefner in his finest silk smoking jac ALI (CONT'D)
Cute jammies. JACK
A gift from my mother. Never worn them. ALI
Go figure. Jack walks past Ali, toward the door. 105. JACK
Forgot to lock up. (HE DOES)
Okay. Night. ALI
Night again. He walks back into the bedroom and once gain shuts the do Ali smiles to herself, plumps her pillow. The door flies open again -- Jack's there in just the pants, no top. JACK
Water. No hangover. He stumbles past Ali to the kitchen, drinks from the tap. After a moment he returns to the bedroom, nodding to Ali. JACK (CONT'D)
Night. Ali just nods. He closes the door. Ali smiles, waiting. After a beat, the door opens again. Jack is there, in box JACK (CONT'D)

Hungry. He walks past her to the kitchen, opens a box of cereal, pours it into his mouth. Grabs some milk from the fridge, pours it into his mouth, too. Returns to the bedroom, crunching. He closes the door. Then -- very quickly -- he opens it again and walks out. JACK (CONT'D)
I know I forgot something else, but I just can't remember what... (TO HIMSELF)
Door locked, water, food... He wanders out into the room, past Ali, and we see from behind he is butt-ass naked. She cracks up. JACK (CONT'D)
What's so funny? She covers her face. He glances down. JACK (CONT'D)
Well I never! He strides back to the bedroom, shutting the door. After moment, he comes back out dressed in an old, flowered bathrobe and fur-lined orange hunting cap. 106. JACK (CONT'D)
I remembered what I forgot to do. ALI
What? JACK (SERIOUS)
Kiss you goodnight. He crosses to her, takes her in his arms, and kisses her. She kisses back, making up for all their lost time. MUSIC UP: "PRISONER" a big, soulful ballad.

CLOSE ON THE LOCK as a key is inserted. The door opens. 109.
A PAIR OF WOMEN'S HEELS enter the apartment and pick thei way over last night's discarded clothes and head for:
Where Jack and Ali are sleeping, entwined. The heels stop the base of the bed. A beat. Then, enraged: NATALIE
Jack bolts up in bed. Stares. JACK
Natalie! Ali blinks awake. Confused. ALI
Natalie? Jack scrambles for something to put on. NATALIE
YOU are a LIAR. You're a sneaky, pathetic LI-AR! ALI
(quiet, to Jack) What 's she doing here: JACK
I don't know! NATALIE
I LIVE HERE, you bleached out tramp, what the hell are YOU doing here?!! ALI (TO JACK)
You were engaged to this woman? JACK
(finds his boxers) Nat, can we talk about this in the living room -- 110. NATALIE
I can't BELIEVE I bought your bullshit: "It's nothing, she's just this chick from work, she's nothing." (TO ALI)
That's what he called you. "Nothing. She's not even pretty. (sizing Ali up) Well, at least you were honest about one thing-- ALI JACK
You said that? No, I didn't --
He most certainly did! Nat-- shut the fu-- ALI NATALIE
Jack?!? Don't even say his name! As Ali grabs for a shirt-- JACK
Listen, Ali-- let me just-- would you mind -- ALI
What?!? JACK
Giving us a little privacy? AL I (OFFENDED)
You want me to leave? NATALIE
Yes you! I'm the fiancee. You're a booty call. You go. JACK
Natalie, Jesus, STOP IT! Ali grabs some pants from the floor, pulls them on. ALI

In one phone call? Please, you don't dump a girl like me on the phone. JACK
Both of you-- STOP IT! As Ali quickly grabs a few things-- JACK (CONT'D)
Ali-- I'm really sorry-- I-- ALI

They start at one million and go up, depending on the view. TESS
What if I told you a twenty-story high-rise was going up where my club is? (TO ALI)

So. Mr. ? BUSINESSMAN
Anderson. TESS

Trying to sell these condos. (BEAT)

I'm listening. TESS

I'm sure you know where the door is. It used to be half yours. (re. the waitress) And take HER with you. Tess turns and goes over to the bar, where Ali spins arou on her barstool, having heard the whole thing. ALI
How'd that feel? TESS

Not half bad. 132. Tess parks it next to her. Looks at Ali. Smiles, then bre into a giggle. Ali smiles. Tess laughs even harder, tears her eyes now. They are just two girls laughing hysterical at the bar, Tess keeps trying to say something, but can't it out, until she looks Ali square in the eye... TESS (CONT'D)
It felt pretty God damn awesome! And they crack up again. Then... ALI

Oh, Jesus, here it comes. ALI
.What was it you said to me that first night? "Twenty bucks at the door will make all your dreams come true." That was sweet of you. TESS
Are you finished? ALI
(loving needling her) Kinda ironic, when you think about it. I started off begging you to make my dreams come true, and here we are -- TESS
All right already! You want me to say it, I'll say it. She looks at her. TESS (CONT'D)
This place is the love of my life. The only dream I've ever had. I don't know what I would have done if I had lost it. (HEARTFELT NOW)

Again. NIKKI

Just like that? TESS

TESS (CONT'D)
